Description: Dish of Nile silt pottery with flat base, simple rim, coated with brown-red slip and burnished; decorated on the interior in thick pink pigment with 5 chevrons depending from the rim.
Curator's comments: Similar to White Cross lined ware C17m in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921). Published: A. Scharff, Some Prehistoric Vases in the British Museum and Remarks on Egyptian Prehistory, JEA 14 (1928), p. 262, pl. xxv.2.
